cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 55 mi (90 km) south of the eastern tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across Cuba, forecast to enter the Gulf of Mexico Monday night, strengthen into a hurricane, and then track northwest toward the north-western Gulf Coast before recurving inland toward the lower Mississippi Valley and Midwest
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-western Gulf Coast (near the Texas-Louisiana border)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watches now limited to the central Bahamas, Andros Island, Florida Keys (Ocean Reef to Key West, Dry Tortugas) and Florida Bay
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warnings for the northern Dominican Republic coast, entire Haiti coast, southeastern Bahamas, Turks & Caicos, and much of Cuba
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Cuba, southeast and central Bahamas, Florida Keys in the short term; north-western Gulf Coast later in the period
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None (no inland Illinois site listed in wind-probability table)
weather_observation.wind: Gusty winds 25–35 mph possible as the remnants move across Illinois Friday into Saturday
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of tropical moisture could produce 2–4+ inches of rain with localized higher amounts, leading to ponding of water and potential river rises
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief spin-up tornadoes and localized flash flooding cannot be ruled out as the remnant circulation passes
